resources.string: Last night of Dana
Use earphones for a better experience
"Start "
You are Dana, a young wealthy lady whose father is the lord of the county
You have always lived very protected, but you know that an important fate awaits you
Dana
Art by:\nSara Piñeiro
Programmed by:\nRubén Montero
Maid:\nGood morning, milady. Wake up.
Maid:\nTonight the feast convoked by your father will\ntake place.
You:\nToday?
Maid:\nYes, it is. A lot of people will assist.
Maid:\nAnd now, please, dress up. Lord Haymitch has\ncome and wants to see you.
Maid:\nThat young man has been watching over you a\nlot recently.
You:\nLord Haymitch wants to see me? Now?
Maid:\nYes.
See him
Avoid him
You:\nI will go outside as soon as possible.
Maid:\nSure, milady.
You:\nI don\'t want to see Lord Haymitch now.
You:\nPlease, tell him to go away.
Maid:\nI will tell him.
You:\nI should not sleep so much.
You:\nI must wake up and go to the town.
Wake up
Sleep
You:\nI prefer to stay in bed.
You:\nZzz...
You:\nI will dress up and go outside.
You:\nNice to see you, lord Haymitch.
Haymitch:\nNice to see you, lady Dana.
Haymitch:\nHow are you, lady Dana?
Haymitch:\nIs everything going well?
You:\nYes, lord Haymitch. Everything is fine...
Haymitch:\nYou look worried, milady.
You:\nI am only a bit disquiet regarding the feast that will take place tonight.
Haymitch:\nDo not be preoccupied, lady Dana.
Haymitch:\nYour future is brighter than your smile.
You:\nThanks, milord.
Haymitch:\nWould you mind taking a walk with me?
I\'d love it
Sorry, I can\'t
You:\nI appreciate your company very much.
Haymitch:\nFantastic words from a beautiful voice.
You:\nSo, tell me, lord Haymitch.
You:\n...are you attending to the feast tonight?
Haymitch:\nIt is a feast convoked by your father.
Haymitch:\nSo I assume that you will be there, and thus, my answer cannot be other than yes.
You:\nAre you looking forward to see me there?
Haymitch:\nSure, milady.
Haymitch:\nEverything will change tonight.
You:\nWhat do you mean?
Haymitch:\nNothing, lady Dana.
Haymitch:\nI just meant that this night everything will be... glorious.
Haymitch:\nNow, please, enjoy the smell of this marvellous day.
Haymitch:\nSee you tonight, milady.
You:\nI will get prepared for tonight.
You:\nSorry, but I am very busy today.
Haymitch:\nAlright, lady Dana.
Haymitch:\nGet prepared. This night will be as memorable as the first time I saw you
You:\nFor sure, sir.
You:\nI will head to the town.
You:\nMaybe I find something interesting.
